page.title: 01WADE MARSH,ISLE OF THANET
page.content: The area lies near the Thanet resorts next to Minnis Bay and is virtually uninhabited. It consists of coastal farmland intersected by drainage channels including the large Wansum channel, the original boundary of the Isle of Thanet dividing it from the mainland of Kent. Having been subjected to inundation by the sea, notably in 1953 in recent times, it is now protected by a sea wall surmounted by a narrow roadway. This has changed the nature of the area from a wetland into farmland, mostly intensively cultivated. The high fertility of the area produces up to three crops in two years - mostly barley, root crops and brassica varieties.
